sen.j: 五畿内志（ごきないし）とは、江戸時代に編纂された畿内の地誌。
sen.e: Gokionaishi (topography of Kinai region) was a local topography of Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) compiled in the Edo period.
Gokinaishi (topography of Kinai region) was a local topography of Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) compiled in the Edo period.
Gokinaishi (topography of Kinai region) was a local topography of Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara) compiled in the Edo period.

sen.j: 正式名称は『日本輿地通志 畿内部』で、全61巻から成る。
sen.e: Its formal title was "Nihon yochitsushi kinaibu" and it was composed totally of 61 volumes.
Its formal title was "Nihon yochitsushi kinaibu" and it was composed totally of 61 volumes.
Its formal title was "Nihon yochitsushi kinaibu" and it was composed totally of 61 volumes.

sen.j: 寺社奉行大岡忠相より地誌編纂を命じられた並河誠所らが6年間を費やして実地調査し、享保19年（1734年）に完成させた。
sen.e: Seisho NAMIKAWA, who had been ordered to compile local topography by Tadasuke OOKA, the jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines), conducted field research over six years, and completed in 1734.

Seisho NAMIKAWA, who had been ordered to compile local topography by Tadasuke OOKA, the jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines), conducted field research over six years, and completed it in 1734.
sen.cmt: 文法を修正しました。completed→completed it
sen.e: Seisho NAMIKAWA, who had been ordered to compile local topography by Tadasuke OOKA, the jisha-bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines), conducted field research over six years, and completed it in 1734.

sen.j: 実地調査の過程で、所在不明の延喜式式内社の比定が数多く行われている。
sen.e: In the course of field research he identified many Engishikinaisha which had been the location unknown.
In the course of field research he identified many Engishikinaisha which had been the location unknown.
In the course of field research he identified many Engishikinaisha which had been the location unknown.

sen.j: 刊本は『大日本地誌大系』に収録された。
sen.e: The published book was collected in "Dainihon chishi taikei"
The published book was collected in "Dainihon chishi taikei."
The published book was collected in "Dainihon chishi taikei."
